concise_definition: adj./pron. 两者都, 两个都

definitions.explanation_en: Used to refer to two people or things considered together, indicating that each of the two is included.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于指代两个被共同考虑的人或事物，表示两者都被包括在内。
definitions.example_en: Both of my parents are doctors.

definitions.explanation_en: Used to replace two previously mentioned items or people, emphasizing that neither is excluded.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于替代前文提到的两个事物或人，强调两者均未被排除。
definitions.example_en: I tried both, but I liked the red one better.
definitions.example_cn: 我试了两个，但我更喜欢红色的那个。

definitions.explanation_en: Used with 'and' to connect two equal elements, indicating that both are true or applicable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与 'and' 连用，连接两个并列成分，表示两者都成立或适用。
definitions.example_en: She is both intelligent and hardworking.

comparison.analysis: “All”（全部）用于三个或三个以上的人或事物，表示整体包含；而 “both” 仅限于两个对象。例如，“All students passed” 指所有学生（三人以上），而 “Both students passed” 仅指两个学生。
“Either”（两者之一）表示在两个选项中任选其一，具有选择性；而 “both” 表示两者都包括，无选择余地。例如，“You can take either book” 意为选一本，而 “You can take both books” 意为两本都可以拿。
“Neither”（两者都不）是 “both” 的否定对应词，表示两个都不包含。例如，“Both answers are correct” 与 “Neither answer is wrong” 意义相反，前者肯定两者，后者否定两者。
